CatDescriptText: Mrs. Martha Dixon, 267 Dinwiddie Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 16, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that Negroes are giving sufficient financial help to the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People?" answer reads: "I think those who are able to give are giving and others would like to give but are not able."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Martha Dixon, wearing dark belted dress with jacquard rose pattern and brooch, dark jacket and hat with polka dot trim, and eyeglasses, standing on sidewalk with pedestrians and storefront with sign inscribed "Lovelier Fashions for Less" in background
